channel.title: Business Insider - Home
channel.description: Official Web Portal of Business Insider

item.title: Chattogram port to buy 11 gantry cranes for Tk130 crore
item.description: The proposal for procurement of the cranes will be placed before the Cabinet Committee on Public Purchase on Wednesday.

item.title: ‘Need concerted commitment for char development’
item.description: Bangladesh has gone through amazing socio-economic transformations, but the fruits of this progress could not be distributed as equitably as desired across the country within 50 years of independence, eminent economist and former governor of Bangladesh Bank Dr Atiur Rahman

item.title: Uttara fast food joint raided over VAT evasion
item.description: A team of the VAT Audit Intelligence and Investigation Directorate (VATAIID), led by its deputy director Tanvir Ahmed, conducted the raid at the Manik Foods on specific allegations of VAT evasion.

item.title: Luxury cruise ship reaches St. Martin with over 500 tourists
item.description: MV Bay One, a luxurious cruise ship, began its journey from Cox’s Bazar to St. Martin Island on Monday.

item.title: Robi set to debut in capital market on Dec 24
item.description:
One of the country&rsquo;s leading digital service provider, Robi Axiata Limited, is going to hit the trading floors in Dhaka and Chittagong Stock Exchange on December 24. The company will start trading under &ldquo;N&rdquo; category with the trading code &ldquo;ROBI.&rdquo;

item.title: CSE Shariah Index reshuffled
item.description:
Chittagong Stock Exchange (CSE) has rearranged its Shariah Index with effect from December 30 in line with the performance of the companies listed with the country&rsquo;s second bourse.
Sonali Paper and Board Mills Limited has been added to the index, which

item.title: ‘Democratisation of nat’l budget must for fair society’
item.description:
There is no alternative to democratisation of the national budgetary process for a non-discriminatory society, said Dr Salehuddin Ahmed, former governor of the Bangladesh Bank.
Although the share of the budget supply mostly comes through indirect taxes, there is no reflection

item.title: Community Bank MD’s mother passes away
item.description: Members of the bank’s board of directors and management and employees of the bank have expressed their deepest condolences on her departure.

item.title: Primary Dealers Bangladesh Limited holds 12th AGM
item.description:
The 12th annual general meeting of Primary Dealers Bangladesh Limited (PDBL) was held virtually on Sunday with Md Ataur Rahman Prodhan, the chairman of PDBL and CEO and Managing Director of Sonali Bank Limited in the chair.
Managing directors, chief executives

item.title: HSBC launches state-of-the-art branch in Dhanmondi
item.description: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation (HSBC) in Bangladesh has officially relaunched its state-of-the-art Dhanmondi branch at the tenth floor of Bay’s Park Height.

item.title: Khana’s holds annual conference
item.description: The annual conference of the fast food chain ‘Khana`s’ was held in Dhaka on December 18

item.title: Bangladesh signs $50m deal with ADB to finance virus-hit microenterprises
item.description: The government has signed a $50 million in additional loan agreement with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to help restore the economic activities of microenterprises severely affected by the Covid-19 pandemic

item.title: Mir Akhter Hossain IPO: Key things to know before investing
item.description: Mir Akhter Hossain’s Tk125 crore initial public offering (IPO) will open for subscription on Thursday.

item.title: GE urges quick deployment of renewables, gas power for faster decarbonisation
item.description: Building on its commitment to carbon neutrality in its operations by 2030 and announced intention to exit the new-build coal power market, General Electric (GE) on Monday said accelerated and strategic deployment of both renewable energy and gas power can

item.title: Md Kazim Uddin new CEO of National Life Insurance
item.description: Before joining as the CEO, he had been serving as Acting CEO in the company

item.title: NRB Global Bank formally opens its 5 Islamic banking sub-branches
item.description: NRB Global Bank has formally opened its 5 Islamic banking sub-branches

item.title: Padma Bank inaugurates agent banking outlet in Khulna Sadar
item.description: Padma Bank`s Vice Chairman Hasan Taher Imam inaugurated the outlet as the chief guest from Dhaka head office through a virtual platform on Monday

item.title: United Commercial Bank inaugurates 199th Branch at Thakurgaon
item.description: United Commercial Bank Limited (UCB) has inaugurated its 199th branch at Thakurgaon

item.title: Jamuna Bank launches agent banking in Cumilla
item.description: Jamuna Bank Limited has recently launched its agent banking operation with agent outlet M/S J Enterprise in Cumilla

item.title: Stocks snap three-day losing streak
item.description: The market opened on a positive note in the morning before climbing steadily at close.

item.title: FSIBL holds virtual EGM
item.description: Mohammed Saiful Alam, chairman of the Board of Directors of FSIBL, presided over the meeting.

item.title: Covid-19: 4.5cr people to be vaccinated by May-June next year
item.description: The government on Monday took a decision to provide coronavirus vaccine to 4.5crore people across the country by May to June next year.

item.title: Union Bank inaugurates Rowshanhat sub-branch
item.description: Union Bank Limited has inaugurated a sub-branch in Chattogram’s Roushanhat area

item.title: Covid-19: 32 deaths, 1,470 cases recorded in last 24hrs
item.description: Bangladesh recorded 32 more deaths and 1,470 new cases of novel coronavirus from different parts of the country including capital Dhaka in the last 24 hours ending 8:00am on Monday.

item.title: Bagha Jatin statue vandalism: 3 including Jubo League man placed on 3-day remand
item.description: A Kushtia court on Monday placed three people including a local leader of Awami League’s youth front Jubo League on three-day remand each in connection with a case filed for vandalising a sculpture of British revolutionary leader Bagha Jatin in the district town.

item.title: Runner Automobiles approves 10% cash dividend
item.description:
The 20th annual general meeting (AGM) of Runner Automobiles Limited has been completed where shareholders approved 10% cash dividend as per the board&rsquo;s recommendation for the financial year ended on June 30.
The approval was given at the AGM held on

item.title: Bangladesh moves 2 notches up in Human Development Index
item.description: Bangladesh has moved up two notches in the traditional Human Development Index (HDI) to 133 compared to last year, says a new report on Monday.

item.title: Coca-Cola, Kewkradong mark 10th year of cleaning up St Martin’s
item.description: More than 4,500 volunteers collected around 12,000kg marine debris since 2011.

item.title: Dhaka most polluted cities in world
item.description: Dhaka, one the most polluted cities in the world, ranked worst in the Air Quality Index (AQI) on Monday morning.

item.title: Britain hit by virus travel bans as US reaches stimulus deal
item.description: A number of country worldwide banned arrivals from the UK on Sunday over a new highly infectious coronavirus strain Britain said was “out of control”, as the WHO called for stronger containment measures.
